title: Fetterman Was an Uneven Debater Long Before His Stroke
description: Lt. Gov. John Fetterman of Pennsylvania, the state’s Democratic nominee for Senate, was widely considered the least verbally agile among three candidates during an April primary debate.
dc:creator: Trip Gabriel
media:description: The campaign of Lt. Gov. John Fetterman, Pennsylvania’s Democratic Senate nominee, itself recently downplayed his debate skills in a memo to reporters that tried to lower the bar for his performance against Dr. Mehmet Oz, the Republican nominee and longtime television personality.
